Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2008 04:45PM CBJ wrote: Kim - Keep me posted on your progress and what your dr says as to follow up and reoccurrance.  I was dx Jan 8th, 2008 and had a masectomy of the left side along with a SNB and they took 4/5 nodes.  I had the option of a lumpectomy with rads, but worried about reoccurance.  I also had an expander put in at the time and will start the recon process.  I just worry that there could be something else in the underlying area or could it come back in the other side. I just want to know what other Paget's patients think.   Hannabanana - Hey girl!  Glad to see you back on line and I do hope your recovery is going well.  Have you got your paths report back yet.  Keeping you in my thoughts. Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2008 08:21PM CBJ wrote: hi - i, too, am sad and pissed off!!!  i am too young for this crap!  i am three weeks,monday, from my masectomy and snb and i seem to be getting worse. i have two small babies that i still cannot pick up, i am taking some of it out on my husband - who has been wonderful during all of this, and have been avoiding all my friends.  i don't understand why....
Posts.Title: sadness ivy62 Dansmom

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2008 02:01AM CBJ wrote: I, too, was diagnoised with paget's disease (age 37) i just had a masectomy and snb on mon.  thank goodness everything went well and my path reports came back good.  they were able to get it all so i am now cancer free.  i love those two words.  i was given two options - a masectomy of the left breast, or a lumpectomy with radiation.  i opted for the masectomy to lower my chances of a reoccurrance, for clean margins, and for better results with reconstruction.  there is not a whole lot about this disease on the web, but please get all the appropriate test to make sure there is no underlying cancer.  you will be bombarded with info from doctors, family, friends, and well wishers.  take some in, filter some and you will make the right decision for you.  Also, a big help was talking to the plastic surgeon so i knew exactly what the process was for each option regarding reconstruction, since this was important to me.  contact the breast cancer community to find doctors who have dealt with paget's and also a plastic surgeon who has been reconized for their work in the masectomy community.  it's a tough road, esp since there are so few with paget's, but you will get through it.  i still have a long road in front of me with recovery and reconstrution, but it's okay now that i am cancer free.  good luck to you and stay in touch
Posts.Title: Paget's breast cancer Hannahbanana Hannahbanana

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2008 09:54PM CBJ wrote: My PS removed the drain and I am still having a lot of fluid buildup.  I went back for him to check it and he could tell where the fluid is acummulating and says that it is starting the stretching process, but very uncomfortable.  I feel my range of motion is still limited and driving is still an issue for me due to rom.  I still can't pick up my babies.  Is this common as I am four weeks out this monday of my masectomy with SNB and expanders? What is odd is that I feel a lot of pulling/stretching where my drain was inserted.  Anyone else felt this?  Thanks so much for the support.
Posts.Title: Drain Removal CBJ otter

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2008 03:58AM CBJ wrote: Hi there - I never had a rash.  All I had was a little bit of itching around my nipple.  This prompted me to see the doctor, who sent me for a mammogram (which came back neg), then to a breast surgeon who did a biopsy.  I am her second paget's only case in their 30's.  My bro in law is a doctor for 15-20 years and has never seen a case.  Go for the MRI to help you get a better understanding of what you are dealing with.  My MRI was an eyeopener as it was the first time in all of this that I realized Yes I am a breast cancer patient, as they put the hospital ID on my arm.  After gathering all the info I could tolerate, and talking to my doctors, I was just ready to move on with it all.  That is one of the main reasons for opting for the masectomy.  If I did the lumpectomy and radiation, then had a reoccurance, or there may be some left, then that may interfere with my reconstuction, and this is important to me.  I am to young to look at these scars and I do not want to always worry - is it back.  A great book to read is Crazy Sexy Cancer by Kris Carr.  She has a great outlook on dealing with cancer, making decisions, and just coping with it all.  Please contact me any time with any thing.  I am here for you girl!  You can and will do what is right for you!!
Posts.Title: Paget's breast cancer Hannahbanana Hannahbanana
